questions.question: What is the best time to visit Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Cover monsoon vs winter vs summer. Best months are Oct-Mar with temperatures 5-25°C. Include Baisakhi (April), Diwali timing, and Golden Temple crowd levels during festivals.

questions.question: How many days do you need in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Suggest 2-3 days minimum. Day 1: Golden Temple and Jallianwala Bagh. Day 2: Wagah Border and local markets. Day 3: Partition Museum and food tours.

questions.question: How to reach Golden Temple from Amritsar railway station?
questions.contentDirection: Distance 2km, auto-rickshaw ₹30-50, taxi ₹80-100, walking route via GT Road. Include landmark references like Hall Bazaar.

questions.question: What are the timings for Wagah Border ceremony?
questions.contentDirection: Summer 6:15 PM, winter 4:15 PM. Arrive 2 hours early for good seats. VIP gallery tickets ₹100, include security check procedures.

questions.question: Where to eat the best kulcha in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Kulcha Land, Amritsari Kulcha Hub near Golden Temple, Bharawan Da Dhaba. Include prices ₹80-150 per kulcha, best varieties (aloo, paneer, mixed).

questions.question: What is famous street food in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Amritsari kulcha, lassi, jalebi, fish from Kesar Da Dhaba. Cover Lawrence Road food street, Hall Bazaar snacks, prices ₹50-200.

questions.question: Where to try authentic Amritsari fish?
questions.contentDirection: Makhan Fish Corner, Beera Chicken House, Kesar Da Dhaba. Include preparation style, prices ₹200-400, vegetarian alternatives.

questions.question: Best places for lassi in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Gian Chand Lassi, Ahuja Lassi near Golden Temple, flavors available, prices ₹30-80, traditional clay glasses vs modern cups.

questions.question: What is the history of Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Built by Guru Ram Das in 1577, gold plating by Maharaja Ranjit Singh. Include architectural details, significance in Sikhism, Operation Blue Star context.

questions.question: What happened at Jallianwala Bagh?
questions.contentDirection: April 13, 1919 massacre details, General Dyer's role, bullet marks still visible, memorial significance, entry timings 9 AM-7 PM.

questions.question: What to see at Partition Museum Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Located in Town Hall, 1947 partition stories, artifacts, personal accounts, entry fee ₹25, timings 10 AM-6 PM, guided tour availability.

questions.question: History of Maharaja Ranjit Singh and Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Sikh Empire capital, Summer Palace, contributions to Golden Temple, museum at Ram Bagh Palace, artifacts and weapons display.

questions.question: What to buy in Hall Bazaar Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Phulkari embroidery, juttis, religious items, spices. Include shop recommendations, bargaining tips, prices ₹200-2000 for textiles.

questions.question: Best shopping areas in Amritsar for tourists?
questions.contentDirection: Hall Bazaar, Katra Jaimal Singh, Lawrence Road, Shastri Market. Include specialties of each market, timings, parking availability.

questions.question: Where to buy authentic Phulkari in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Hall Bazaar shops, Katra Jaimal Singh. Difference between machine vs hand embroidery, prices ₹800-5000, authenticity tips.

questions.question: What cultural experiences can you have in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Golden Temple langar service, Punjabi folk dance shows, village tours near Amritsar, traditional cooking classes, Sikh history walks.

questions.question: How to participate in Golden Temple langar?
questions.contentDirection: Free community kitchen, how to volunteer, meal times, etiquette, washing dishes seva, dress code requirements.

questions.question: What festivals are celebrated in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Baisakhi in April, Guru Nanak Jayanti, Diwali celebrations at Golden Temple, Hola Mohalla, specific dates and celebrations.

questions.question: Is there any nightlife in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Limited nightlife, hotel bars, Ranjit Avenue restaurants, Golden Temple night visit, evening food walks, most places close by 10 PM.

questions.question: Best rooftop restaurants in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Sagar Ratna rooftop, hotel restaurants with Golden Temple view, Crystal Restaurant, prices ₹400-800 per person, evening ambiance.

questions.question: What is the dress code for Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Head covering mandatory, no shoes, modest clothing, free scarves available, what not to wear, locker facilities ₹10.

questions.question: How to do parikrama at Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Clockwise walking around sarovar, early morning 4 AM best time, duration 30-45 minutes, prayer recitation, photography etiquette.

questions.question: What are other gurudwaras to visit in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Gurudwara Baba Atal Rai, Gurudwara Shaheed Ganj, Gurudwara Bibeksar Sahib, distances from Golden Temple, historical significance.

questions.question: Can non-Sikhs visit Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: All religions welcome, respectful behavior expected, same dress code applies, participation in prayers optional, langar open to all.

questions.question: Where to stay near Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Hotel Golden Tulip, Hotel CJ International, heritage havelis, gurudwara accommodation, prices ₹1500-8000, walking distance options.

questions.question: How much money do you need for 2 days in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Budget breakdown: accommodation ₹1500-3000, food ₹500-1000, transport ₹300-500, entry fees ₹100, shopping ₹1000-3000.

questions.question: Is Amritsar safe for solo female travelers?
questions.contentDirection: Generally safe, crowded areas like Golden Temple very secure, avoid late night wandering, dress modestly, reliable taxi services available.

questions.question: How to get from Amritsar to Wagah Border?
questions.contentDirection: 30km distance, taxi ₹800-1200 round trip, bus service ₹50, timing important for ceremony, return transport arrangements.

questions.question: What to do in Amritsar besides Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Wagah Border, Jallianwala Bagh, Partition Museum, Gobindgarh Fort, Ram Bagh Gardens, food tours, heritage walks.

questions.contentDirection: Old City heritage walk, Partition history walk, Sikh heritage tour, morning walks 7-10 AM, guided tour costs ₹500-1000.

questions.question: What is special about Amritsari cuisine?
questions.contentDirection: Heavy use of ghee, tandoor cooking, kulcha-chole combination, dairy products, Punjabi flavors, influence of wheat-based dishes.

questions.question: Where to see traditional Punjabi architecture in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Golden Temple architecture, Gobindgarh Fort, old havelis in Katra areas, Ram Bagh Palace, traditional building elements.

questions.question: How far is Amritsar from Pakistani border?
questions.contentDirection: 28km to Wagah Border crossing, visa requirements for Pakistan, Kartarpur Corridor details, border area restrictions.

questions.contentDirection: Early morning 4-6 AM, late evening 9-10 PM, weekdays vs weekends, avoid festival dates, monsoon season fewer crowds.

questions.contentDirection: Entry fee ₹60, museum displays, cultural shows, Maharaja Ranjit Singh artifacts, fort architecture, sound and light show timings.

questions.contentDirection: Ram Bagh Gardens, Jallianwala Bagh memorial park, Company Bagh, entry fees, best time to visit, jogging tracks available.

questions.contentDirection: Village tours in Majitha, farming experiences, traditional cooking, folk dance performances, day trip costs ₹2000-4000.

questions.contentDirection: Auto-rickshaws ₹20-50, cycle-rickshaws ₹15-30, city buses ₹8-15, taxi services, app-based cabs, rental bicycles.

questions.contentDirection: Highest Sikh authority, political decisions, located opposite Golden Temple, architectural importance, historical events.

questions.contentDirection: Central Sikh Museum at Golden Temple, Partition Museum, guided heritage walks, Gobindgarh Fort museum, library resources.

questions.question: How to reach Amritsar from Delhi?
questions.contentDirection: Train options: Shatabdi Express 6 hours ₹1500, flights 1.5 hours ₹4000-8000, bus 8 hours ₹800-1500, road distance 460km.

questions.question: What souvenirs to buy from Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Phulkari dupattas, religious books, kada (steel bracelets), kirpan replicas, dry fruits, pickles, carpets, price ranges.

questions.question: Are there any lakes or water bodies near Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Golden Temple sarovar (holy tank), Kanjli Wetland 15km away, birdwatching opportunities, boat rides not available in sarovar.

questions.question: What is the weather like in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Hot summers 35-45°C, cold winters 2-15°C, monsoon July-Sept, fog in December-January, best months October-March.

questions.question: How to attend evening prayer at Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Rehras Sahib timing 6-7 PM, Sukhasan ceremony 9-10 PM, sitting arrangements, participation etiquette, photography rules.

questions.question: What are the food timings at Golden Temple langar?
questions.contentDirection: 24/7 service, peak meal times 12-2 PM and 7-9 PM, breakfast 8-10 AM, queue management, menu items served.

questions.contentDirection: Durgiana Temple, Tarn Taran Sahib 25km, Goindwal Sahib, Kartarpur Corridor, rural village experiences, travel costs.

questions.contentDirection: Golden Temple free, Jallianwala Bagh free, Wagah Border free, Partition Museum ₹25, Gobindgarh Fort ₹60, photography charges.

questions.contentDirection: Holy water tank, purification beliefs, Amrit sarovar meaning, architectural beauty, reflection photography, feeding fish tradition.
